root.para: In many financial reporting frameworks, financial instruments, including embedded derivatives, are often measured at fair value for the purpose of balance sheet presentation, calculating gain or loss, or disclosure. In general, the objective of fair value measurement is to arrive at the price at which an orderly transaction to sell an asset or transfer a liability would take place between market participants at the measurement date under current market conditions (that is, at an exit price at the measurement date from the perspective of the market participant that holds the asset or owes the liability). In meeting this objective, all relevant available market information is taken into account.
